conclusion: Analyze paths of liquids from points A, B, and C to determine which container they will flow into.
Liquid flows from A to the right.
Liquid from A encounters a purple baffle that directs it downward.
Liquid from A continues downward and flows into container D.
Liquid flows from B to the right.
Liquid from B encounters a green baffle that directs it downward.
Liquid from B continues downward and flows into container E.
Liquid flows from C to the right.
Liquid from C encounters a brown baffle that directs it downward.
Liquid from C continues downward and flows into container F.
Liquid from A flows into container D.
Liquid from B flows into container E.
Liquid from C flows into container F.
Final answer: Liquid from A will flow into container D, from B into container E, and from C into container F.
